cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi (145 km) southeast of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest over the Yucatán today, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico Tuesday, then accelerate north-northeast across the U.S. Gulf Coast Wednesday and the southern Appalachians into the Mid-Atlantic Thursday–Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana / Mississippi coast (northern Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches confined to Intracoastal City LA eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm warnings limited to the Yucatán Peninsula of Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone from southeast Louisiana across Mississippi/Alabama and inland through the Tennessee Valley; secondary impacts across GA/SC/NC Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 30–40 mph possible late Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the South Carolina coast from Zeta
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible late Thursday into early Friday as remnants pass inland northwest of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out on Thursday in coastal South Carolina outer rainbands.
